name: Hotel Dali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Hotel Dali because of the great price, location, and free parking. The rooms were basic and clean. The rooms are a bit outdated, but was very roomy. We had a room with a private bathroom facing the street. It can get very loud at night, so I would recommend asking for a room facing the courtyard if you are a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Good value and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best feature of this hotel is the amazing location. Everything is walking distance from the hotel. The Duomo is just a block a way and the Uffizi, Academia, and other points of interests are all reachable on foot. Just a warning for drivers: Florence is a nightmare to drive into. Beware of one way streets and crazy traffic. Also, the parking for this hotel is free but very difficult to get into. The entrance is extremely narrow and you have to be careful not to scratch your rental.
reviews.title: great hotel for a great price

reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights for 60 Euro per night, and it was a wondeful stay. The room was fairly spartan but clean and comfortable. We had our own bathroom, and overlooked a small courtyard. We didn't hear any noise from the street at all. The location is absolutely wonderful, and the price couldn't be better- we would recommend the Hotel Dali to anyone.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location and very adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't explain how great this location is. You walk outside and the Duomo is right there. The staff was extremely friendly-- I wish we had used them as a resource sooner. They gave us recommendations and maps. The price was good, but obviously it's pretty bare bones: no services, but it is clean and nice-looking. But given the nature of Florence, you won't be spending too much time in the room anyway. A good find for sure.
reviews.title: Excellant basic buget accommodation, can't get better location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: basic room with shower, toilet, sink. We had the room right behind the front desk so we could hear everyone talking to the front desk and we were also right next to the street. Since it was low season, being next to the street wasn’t a problem. We weren’t in the room during the day, and once we got back in late at night, we were too exhausted and couldn’t stay awake. There was a mini TV in the room, but all the channels were in Italian.
reviews.title: Excellent choice _Cinzia_Panayiotis_ Greece
Okay but look elsewhere
reviews.text: Hotel Dali is in a great location close to the all major sites and few mins walk to Galleria Accademia and duomo. The room overlooking the courtyard is by far the best room that includes a kettle and small fridge - no other place in europe we stayed had this. Rooms are clean and one bathroom large, the other very small with no hooks to hang clothes or towels etc. The staff are very helpful and extremely thoughtful and you cannot fault this. Marco the owner speaks excellent English and Grazia not a word of English but is soooo nice and very helpful. The accommodation is very basic, rooms are average and the ones on the street are quite noisy, poky and I wouldn't want to stay more than a couple of nites. We were asked to move rooms so I can comment on both rooms. We prebooked the accommo but would suggest that there are other hotels same price or cheaper close by that offer more facilities and are good, so look around. You would have no trouble in October finding accommodation on arrival. The stay was okay but I would not stay here again. NOTE: On check-out we were told cash only, so had to rush off to find an ATM, we could have been told this at check-in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A small and a very friendly hotel made staying in Florence even better than it already was.
reviews.title: Perfect place for staying in Florence

reviews.text: Dali is a small familiy hotel, located in a quiet place but only within 3 minutes walk from the magnificent Duomo.
reviews.title: A best little place to stay in Florence

likes.liked: — Clean, secure, friendly-helpful people, close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's really clean and comfortable, and the staff is very very friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent Value in Florence
Florentine value
reviews.text: Marco speaks great English, and is really helpful. All of the staff is really nice and welcoming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Dali for four nights and found the service excellent and the room large and comfortable. The grand double bed was very comfortable and the tea-making facilitities most welcome! The room had a fridge and en suite bathroom. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but there was plenty of hot water and good quality towels. My only criticism with the room was that it faced onto the street. Now, I'm a heavy sleeper and have snoozed through great storms but the noise of revellers on the street continued until 2am most nights and managed to wake us both. That said, this is hardly the fault of the hotel and, had I asked, we could have been moved to the courtyard side of the building.
reviews.title: A good, clean & friendly hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was a good choice and an amazing location. It's a pity that breakfast was not provided. My only tip - opt for a bedroom not facing the street.
reviews.title: Great value, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Dali has simple but comfortable accomodations. The rooms were clean and well equipped, but did feel slightly dingy. With flourescent lamps and linoleum floors, and cracks in the walls i wasn't encouraged to hang out in my room. still it sufficed for overnights--beds were very comfortable. Maybe other rooms are more comfy? The staff is very friendly and helpful with museum reservations and recommendations, etc. Would stay here again if i was on a budget.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night only. Our room is clean, "big" & quiet facing courtyard. Marco is very friendly & nice. He helped us with the musuem reseravtions & sight seeing places. Would definitely stay again if I ever visit Florence. Its worth the money we spent.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Dali for a couple nights and were very pleased with our decision to stay there. All of the front desk staff were very friendly. Marco, the main staffer, spoke good English and even the ladies who didn't speak English got their point across and would just laugh over the language barrier.
reviews.title: Great location, a relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had a great location. Everything was within walking distance. The desk clerk Marco was great. He was more than willing to help us find little stores and great places for dinner. The hotel doesn't have a lot of frills but you aren't going to Florence to stay in a hotel room. We got a double bed which was really 2 twins pushed together which was great. We had our own full bathroom which was small but functional. Would definately recommend for a nice clean place to sleep.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: I attribute our wonderful stay in Florence to Marco at Hotel Dali. When we checked in he gave us a city map and circled everything we would want to see while in Florence and recommended restaurants. He booked our tickets in advance (upon request) for Accadamia and Uffizi Museums. We had a condensed visit to Florence and staying at Hotel Dali enabled us to do alot in a short time. The rooms were clean and roomy for 4 adults. We stayed on courtyard side which was quiet. At first glance the stairway was a bit scary but felt welcoming by the second ascent when we were foot-weary. Staying at Hotel Dali was like staying with relatives, very homelike and friendly.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel Dali for 1 night. We had a room with an ensuite bathroom.
reviews.title: Basic hotel for a fair price!
A Treasure in Tuscany
reviews.text: Our room was pretty basic. The bed was comfortable. The room was clean. The bathroom was small but manageable. The shower however didn't drain properly. Water drained really slowly, so our shower was quick to prevent any flooding.
There is no cable or satelliate for the TV and there was no internet connect. But what we paid for the room, i'd say it's a pretty good deal for European standards.
reviews.title: Loved the Staff

description: The Hotel Dal� is located in an old palace owned by the Marquis Frescobaldi, renowned by name to Italians and to wine producers worldwide. The hotel's peaceful setting is centrally located within old town Florence on Via dell'Oriuolo ("The Clock Road" in ancient Florentine). This little cobblestone road is still filled with "botteghe" (artisan shops), where carpenters, jewellers and frame-makers can be found at work. Marco and Samanta, a very nice couple native to Florence and experts in providing unparalleled comfort and service, manage the hotel. Their welcome will make you feel at home. They will be happy to help you by offering nice suggestions that will enhance your experience of the true Florentine style.
